 Be the first one to add a plot.

imdb.plot outline: The Saturday Primetime documentary series Vtori Plan - Second Plan are provoking the viewer of bTV to ask for eternal questions like what is right and who does changes in the dynamics of our shared morality, culture, and sociality. For this purpose, the journalist Martin Karbovski reveals remarkable true-life stories and contrasts them against each other. He explores the myths and the contradictions that we live with, in order to encourage the viewer to discover the story below the surface - the second plan of human existence where nothing is what it looks like. "With the team of these documentary films, we explore the bright and the shady side of life, the advantages and the disadvantages of our community existence. In each broadcast, we look for the cracks in the structure of sociality to discover the causes of good and bad which we frequently do not see. The idea is simple - true, uncensored stories from the kitchen of life", as Martin Karbovski puts it.
imdb.title: Vtori Plan
plot: The successor of the cult "Fatherland Front".Documentary series about the stories below the surface - the second plan of ordinary human existence where nothing is what it looks like.

The Saturday Primetime documentary series _Vtori Plan_ (qv) - Second Plan are provoking the viewer of bTV to ask for eternal questions like what is right and who does changes in the dynamics of our shared morality, culture, and sociality. For this purpose, the journalist Martin Karbovski reveals remarkable true-life stories and contrasts them against each other. He explores the myths and the contradictions that we live with, in order to encourage the viewer to discover the story below the surface - the second plan of human existence where nothing is what it looks like. "With the team of these documentary films, we explore the bright and the shady side of life, the advantages and the disadvantages of our community existence. In each broadcast, we look for the cracks in the structure of sociality to discover the causes of good and bad which we frequently do not see. The idea is simple - true, uncensored stories from the kitchen of life", as Martin Karbovski puts it.
